meanings.definition: A type of animal feed made from the residue of oilseed after the oil has been extracted.
meanings.sent1: The farmer bought poonac to feed his cows.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper uses poonac to nourish the animals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to eat all the poonac before the other animals could get to it.
meanings.sent4: The fields bloomed with life, fueled by the nutritious poonac.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh poonac filled the barn, attracting hungry livestock.

meanings.sent1: The farmer will poonac the horses after they finish their hay.
meanings.sent2: She poonacs the chickens every morning without fail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to poonac the pigs, but they weren't interested.
meanings.sent4: The caretaker gently poonacs the rabbits, ensuring they have enough to eat.
meanings.sent5: In the evening, the children help poonac the sheep before bedtime.

meanings.sent1: The bakery proudly displayed its poonac pastries.
meanings.sent2: The artisan crafted a beautiful poonac necklace.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer created a poonac-inspired dress for the runway.
meanings.sent4: The cozy cabin was decorated with poonac furniture.
meanings.sent5: The unique scent of the room was due to the poonac candles burning softly.
